message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a new method for semantic segmentation using Adaptive Affinity Fields (AAF) and adversarial learning. The method is evaluated on several datasets and achieves above-par segmentation performance and robust generalization across domains. Given the focus on computer vision and machine learning techniques, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves adversarial learning, which suggests a possible fit with cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves the use of semantic labels and relations between neighbouring pixels, which could fit with cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the use of minimax optimization suggests a possible fit with cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
